author: Poxell91

text: Two player adventure mode made this game amazing. The VS mode was great too. I always used this game to settle disputes over who was the best at kart racers. The lack of rubber band AI and good item gifts to bad drivers made this a more "pure" game to me. If you suck at this game, you will be lapped. That just doesn't happen in Mario Kart.
author: swoosh870

text: The blue shell says otherwise; which was introduced in 64.
author: TargetHippo

text: We must be playing 2 different games then.  Never encountered rubber band AI on the 64 version ( won't deny it exists in other versions... fucking Advance/DS games).   And really, as long as you keep 2 items on you (one behind, one in slot), you were good to go.
author: Rusa

text: Huh? Mario Kart is the king of rubber-band AI, especially because of the unfair item system where you get punished for winning and rewarded for losing.

text: Diddy Kong Racing's Adventure Mode was what kept me playing DKR most of the time. :)

text: Mario 64 will always be king of the kart games for that system.  Diddy Kong Racing just pissed me off.  The AI was atrocious and it had that bullshit system where you couldn't catch up or if you got first, they hounded your ass.

author: UFAME

text: Hey SD, I was wondering if you had heard of a game called Thrid Blade? I've been playing it the last few days, pretty addiciting. One thing I have noticed is that it has a very Super Nintendo feel to it. Even the status screen shows just what we need to know; Lvl, HP, Att, and Def with a pretty badass looking drawing of our hero and while all this is going on some badass music is playing in the background. This is the song I wanted you to hear because I think you would like it.
author: UFAME

text: Plus, Rare can still make games on Nintendo handhelds.

text: Yes!!! I've been waiting for you to add this! I listen to this song all the time lol. I had it as a ringtone for a while. I love DKR, such a fun game. I enjoyed it much more than MK64. author: totlyepic

text: Also, to clarify on the subject, Diddy Kong Racing is an IP fully owned by Nintendo. Rare owns the rights to most of the characters in the game. That means Nintendo could make a sequel with the Kongs and other characters. I'd rather have a new game without Conker and friends than... nothing. ;)

text: That's what I was thinking, they're pretty similar except different consoles. There was a bit more adventure in Diddy Kong I think. Also you could fly and be on hovercrafts and stuff. Crash team was really good too and harder from what I rememeber
author: matt036

text: Diddy Kong Racing is clearly better than Mario Kart 64. The only new thing in MK64 was the fact, that the tracks aren't straight flat. Everything else was like the same as in SMK. Even the characters and items were still 2D. While DKR also had hover boats, planes, adventure and 3 battle modes.

author: Just Ryan

text: Even if Mario Kart 64 was still king for me personally at the time, Diddy Kong Racing provided me with many hours of fun. I rented the game so many times I should have﻿ simply bought it.
